description: From French apologétique, from Ancient Greek ἀπολογητικός (apologētikós, “of or suitable for defense”), from ἀπολογέσθαι (apologésthai, “to speak in defense of”); see more at English apology.

adjectives.description: apologetic (comparative more apologetic, superlative most apologetic)

entries.meaning: Having the character of apology; regretfully excusing.
examples: His tone was apologetic as he explained what had happened.

entries.meaning: (dated) Defending by words or arguments; said or written in defense.
